column4: hello chmod question. I'm trying to chmod a directory, i entered sudo chmod o+r /mydirectory  - I received this error chmod: cannot access `/mydirectory': No such file or directory
are you sure the file/directory is there then?
yes. if i run ls -lh theres a d infront of all the permissions
if this helps its a directory in my /var/www
mh shouldn't be any different, do you have permission/own the directory to change permissions for it?
I got it. I had to do it like this: chmod -R o+r /var/www/ktdms/
eh didn't i say that? >_< sorry
do you understand why I couldn't do it like this: chmod -R o+r /ktdms/  - If I was in the directory
yes because the initial slash is wrong
that would be the directory /ktdms not /var/www/ktdms
